extendedIngredients.name: oil
extendedIngredients.original: Oil for deep-frying, about one quart

title: Deep-Fried Shrimp in a Ketchup Garlic Sauce
summary: Deep-Fried Shrimp in a Ketchup Garlic Sauce is a gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian recipe with 4 servings. For $3.17 per serving, this recipe covers 20% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One portion of this dish contains about 24g of protein, 238g of fat, and a total of 2281 calories. It works well as a main course. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. Head to the store and pick up shrimp, green onion, water, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the salt you could follow this main course with the Apple Turnovers Recipe as a dessert. With a spoonacular score of 34%, this dish is rather bad. Try Deep Fried Chicken in Garlic Sauce (Ggan Pung Gi), Baked Batter “Fried” Shrimp with Garlic Dipping Sauce, and Japanese-Style Deep Fried Shrimp for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Shrimp works really well with Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. The St. Michael-Eppan Anger Pinot Grigio with a 4.3 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 23 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: St. Michael-Eppan Anger Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Depending on the soil and microclimate, Pinot gris varies from a simple everyday wine all the way up to absolute top growths. The warm, sun-exposed vineyards of the Anger sites, with their loamy limestone gravel soils, are a textbook example. The Anger Alto Adige Pinot Grigio has a noble structure, nice balance and fine acidity – making it an absolute pleasure to drink. The strong white goes well with fish and fish soup, guinea fowl breast or veal fillet.

instructions: Procedures                                                                              1                                                                            Coat the shrimp with cornstarch and set aside.  Meanwhile, heat the oil in the wok.                                                                                                                              2                                                                            Deep fry the shrimp for two minutes or less, until the shells are golden brown                                                                                                                            3                                                                            Remove the shrimp from the wok and pour off all but a tablespoon of the oil.  Stir-fry the garlic, green onion, and ginger for a minute, then add the rest of the ingredients to the wok. Let the sauce boil down until it's thick and syrupy, about five minutes.                                                                                                                             4                                                                            Reintroduce the shrimp to the wok and stir around to coat the shrimp in the sauce.  Serve immediately.

steps.step: Coat the shrimp with cornstarch and set aside.  Meanwhile, heat the oil in the wok.
Deep fry the shrimp for two minutes or less, until the shells are golden brown
Remove the shrimp from the wok and pour off all but a tablespoon of the oil.  Stir-fry the garlic, green onion, and ginger for a minute, then add the rest of the ingredients to the wok.
Let the sauce boil down until it's thick and syrupy, about five minutes.
Reintroduce the shrimp to the wok and stir around to coat the shrimp in the sauce.
